result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan D Odell

records.addlTxt:
1:01 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Johnathan D O'Dell in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Johnathan D O'Dell.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Counsel ready to proceed on sentencing after revocation

Atty. Steiner is heard on sentence - endorses department's recommendation, will dismiss and read-in charge possession of firearm as a felon, requests 3 yrs initial confinement and 3 yrs ext. supervision
there is sentence credit, Atty. Richards has specific number, hopes def. avails himself of all treatment options in prison setting. Not eligible for earned release or substance abuse programs 

Atty. Richards is heard on sentence - joins states request for 3 yrs. initial confinement, followed by 3 yrs extended supervision. 259 days sentence credit
No comments by Defendant

Court puts findings on the record. Sentences defendant  to 6 yrs in prison - 3 yrs initial confinement, followed by 3 yrs. extended supervision. Leaving conditions up to department
259. days sentence credit.  Court costs of $168 to be collected as a condition of extended supervision

comments by Atty. Richards
22CF95 is dismissed and used as read-in - $1780 seized by law enforcement is ordered forfeited by Court

10:18 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Johnathan D Odell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Johnathan D Odell.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Richards is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will enter a not guilty plea. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
4:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Johnathan D Odell in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Johnathan D Odell.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF95 Initial Appearance 
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Court addresses bond. 
State requests a signature bond. 
Court sets bond $1,000.00 signature bond with standard conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
